title: Clothing Shop
longDescription:
Clothing Shop is a full-stack e-commerce website, written using React/TypeScript (Frontend) and Go (Backend). This was my first project using Go, where I experimented with the language, and different libraries within Go, such as Zap for logging. Although I opted to use local json files for data storage instead of a database, for easier development, I still created a fully functional backend for providing data to the frontend, with serverside filtering.

Also in this project, for the first time, I experimented with testing libraries and implementing unit testing using Vitest and Go's built-in testing library.

This project was a great learning experience for me, where I used alot of new technologies for the first time. In my next project, I plan to built upon this new knowledge further, with the implementation of a proper database, and continued experimentation with the Go programme language to further my knowledge and try out even more libraries and technologies.

title: PlayRates
longDescription:
PlayRates is a full-stack Video Game tracking website, which I built using React/TypeScript (Frontend) and Express.js (Backend). This was my first time creating a backend server, and building a full-stack project, which was a massive learning experience for me.

This website allows for the creation of user accounts; a friendship system; tracking, rating and reviewing of Video Games; etc. My end goal with this project is to add necessary functionalities such as a proper database; secure user accounts and authentication; and a few small improvement, and then host the website live and give access to the public. However, for now, I have put this plan on hold whilst I focus on other projects.

title: sjbsafety.co.uk
summary: A commercial website built for a scaffolding safety business
longDescription:
I developed a commercial website for a scaffolding safety business based in London and surrounding areas.

This was my second freelance web development client, and the project gave me valuable experience in creating a clean, professional, and user-friendly website tailored to meet the client's business needs.

Throughout the development process, I maintained constant communication with the client, to give updates about progress and ensure the website was tailored to their exact requirements.

title: Platform Shooter
longDescription:
Platform Shooter is an unfinished 2d platforming shooter game. I built this project using C++ and the SFML rendering library, which I have also used before to re-create basic games like Pong and Snake. Although unfinished, this project helped me improve on my Object-oriented programming skills, through the creation of a basic game engine, with a machine for handling state.

Due to my focus transitioning to primarily web development, I stopped working on this project, however plan to return to C++ and potentially this project in the future once I am satisfied with my web development ability.

title: Auto-mate
summary: A Discord bot for automation and moderation
longDescription: A Discord bot with many automation and moderation features. I presented this application as the final project for A-Level Computer Science course, where I was tasked with conducting rigorous testing during and following the development. Also, this project was my first experience using Docker for basic containerization.
